title: Strictly's Chris Ramsey reveals horror accident that was never aired
text:

Chris Ramsey has spoken about an event that was hidden from viewers on Sunday's episode of Strictly Come Dancing .

The comedian, 33, who is partnered with professional dancer Karen Hauer on the BBC dancing series, opened up about the accident that could have left his partner axed from the competition.

The funnyman reflected on the moment he and Karen discovered they had been voted through to the next stage of the competition on his and wife Rosie Winter's podcast Sh**ged Married Annoyed.

(Image: PA)

Sharing on his excitement, he said: "I was cheering so much when we got through that I pushed her [Karen] down the stairs.

"We were on a step and she fell backwards and had to grab the banister - I picked her back up and everyone was like 'what a d**k'."

Rosie quizzed: "Was she alright?"

Revealing Karen managed to remain unscathed from the accident, Chris added: "She was fine, I picked her back up."

(Image: BBC)

He joked: "She’s a solid ball of muscle, I would be more worried about the stairs if I was you!"

Chris himself has had a tricky time in the dance studio and recently shared that practising the Charleston ahead of last week's show left him in tatters.

Chris posted a picture on Instagram showing his medically strapped up arms and shoulders as be explained the extent of his injuries in the caption.

He wrote: "I've worked flat out this week and my body is in bits! Pulled my tricep, shoulder and glutes (a*** muscles for the scientists among us).

"I’m all strapped up like a real dancer! I haven’t done a cartwheel since junior school and I had to do about 200 this week."

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: INSTAGRAM)

He revealed this was hopefully the end of his cartwheeling career, adding: "Hopefully last night’s performance was the final cartwheels of my dancing career, and I can move onto something else if I’m still in the show next week..."

The high-energy routine scored a score of 26, redeeming Chris after his shaky start the previous week.

His Charleston with Karen to Take That's song Out Of Our Heads saw them shoot up the leaderboard, perhaps making Chris aching muscles worth it.

description: The Strictly Come Dancing comedian opened up about an accident that happened during the results show which viewers never saw
